thread.title: Rincon Police: One shot fired during rash of car break-ins
thread.title_full: Rincon Police: One shot fired during rash of car break-ins | savannahnow.com

author: G.G. Rigsby
title: Rincon Police: One shot fired during rash of car break-ins
text:
Photos Rincon Police Related Stories Rincon Police: Burglar finds hide-a-key in fake sprinkler head Rincon Police: Counterfeit $50 bills passed at Lowes Rincon Police: Wife cited for letting unlicensed husband drive Rincon Police: Woman arrested for $27 shoplifting questions officer's priorities Rincon Police: Man late for work drives 108 mph, is arrested Rincon Police: Driver who sped through school zone had suspended license By G.G. Rigsby From incident reports at the Rincon Police Department:
Sept. 27: A pickup truck got stuck in the mud on Lisa Street. The driver was asleep on the back seat.
He was arrested for possession of marijuana and possession of drug-related objects.
Sept. 27: Two women argued in Walmart's parking lot at 2 a.m. One was arrested on a Hinesville warrant for failure to appear.
TV theft
Sept. 28: Walmart reported the theft of a 43-inch TV at 12:30 a.m. on Aug. 1, valued at $576. A man and two women used silicon caulking to prevent the anti-theft device from sounding an alarm. They took the TV out of the box and handed it through the wire fence in the gardening department.
Sept. 28: A couple argued about infidelity. An officer oversaw the man retrieve his ID card and Social Security card.
Sept. 28: Officers stopped a vehicle on Ga. 21 at Fort Howard Road because they thought it might be driven by someone with a suspended license. The driver was arrested for possession of marijuana and not wearing a seatbelt.
Drug arrest
Sept. 28: An officer responded to a car in a ditch at Lisa Street and Fort Howard Road. The driver said she had inhaled from an aerosol can while in Walmart's parking lot and had smoked marijuana earlier in the day.
She was arrested for possession of a controlled substance, possession of a drug-related object, pills not in their original container, drugged driving -- less safe and failure to maintain lane.
Thieves surprised
Sept. 30: A resident of Wiesenbaker Road saw his motion lights go off at 1 a.m. He found three white males going through one of his vehicles. They ran when he confronted them. They took change from the vehicle.
An officer discovered a vehicle at another residence on the street had been entered. Nothing was taken.
Sept. 30: A man said his 18-year-old stepson plays video games and is disrespectful and won't do any chores. The stepson said his stepfather tries to boss him around and he's "not having it." Eviction procedures were explained to the stepfather.
Vehicles entered
Oct. 1: A pistol was stolen from an unlocked minivan on Jasper Lane.
Oct. 1: Someone entered an unlocked pickup truck on Jasper Lane. Nothing was taken.
Oct. 1: A GPS was stolen from a pickup truck on Jasper Lane.
Oct. 1: Several items were stolen from an unlocked vehicle on Market Street, including an iPhone. The items stolen were worth $1,300.
The homeowner said she heard her dog bark at 1 a.m. but didn't check to see what was happening.
Oct. 1: A vehicle was entered on Flint Drive. Nothing was missing.
Oct. 1: Beats headphones, valued at $200, were stolen from a vehicle on Stonewalk Drive. The owner said the vehicle was locked.
Oct. 1: Someone entered a pickup truck on Jasper Lane. The owner said he couldn't tell if anything was missing.
Oct. 1: A tool to break windows, valued at $20, was stolen from a vehicle on Tolliver Lane.
Oct. 1: Someone entered a pickup truck on Diamond Cut and stole $200.
Oct. 1: Two drunken men were ordered to leave the Town Park Inn. One left, but returned soon and was arrested for public drunkenness.
Oct. 1: A man was bitten by a Maltese puppy as he walked on Keller Road. The owner was cited for having a dog at large.
Oct. 1: A hunting knife was stolen from a truck that was unlocked and had the keys in the ignition on St. Andrews Road. The knife was found later on Jasper Lane.
Shot fired
Oct. 1: A resident of Jasper Lane was going to get a coffee cup from his vehicle at 4 a.m, as he was getting ready for work, and he caught a white male inside the vehicle.
The offender fired a pistol at the man as he ran. Officers tracked the suspect with a dog, to a spot where vehicle tire tracks were found.
Oct. 1: Someone entered a vehicle on Jasper Lane. The owner said there was nothing to steal in the vehicle.
Oct. 1: Three vehicles were entered at one residence on Stonewalk Drive. Nothing was stolen.
Oct. 1: Two vehicles were entered at a house on Jasper Lane. A GPS was stolen.
Oct. 1: A vehicle was entered on Jasper Lane. Nothing was stolen.
Oct. 1: An officer answered a call about a loud and angry woman on S. Howard Street. She was stopped in a vehicle on Ninth Street W. and arrested for driving under the influence of alcohol -- less safe.
Oct. 1: A GPS was stolen from a vehicle on Stonewalk Drive. The officer said there were "numerous other" entering auto reports at that time.
Oct. 1: Nothing was stolen but a vehicle was entered on Diamond Cut.
Cash stolen
Oct. 2: Someone stole $2,000 in cash that was left in an unlocked pickup truck on Tolliver Lane. Another vehicle was entered, but nothing was stolen. A third vehicle had an alarm that woke the owner and scared off the thieves.
Oct. 2: An officer stopped a vehicle for weaving on Ga. 21 at Westwood Drive. The woman said she didn't realize she was weaving. She said she was talking to her daughter in the back seat.
She was arrested for driving with a suspended license and failure to maintain lane.
